# VSAccountManagerDelegate

**Protocol**

The methods you use to respond to authentication view controller requests.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol VSAccountManagerDelegate : NSObjectProtocol
```

## Overview

Use the [doc://com.apple.videosubscriberaccount/documentation/VideoSubscriberAccount/VSAccountManagerDelegate] methods to aid in displaying and dismissing authentication view controllers.

If the person isn’t authenticated when your app calls [doc://com.apple.videosubscriberaccount/documentation/VideoSubscriberAccount/VSAccountManager/enqueue(_:completionHandler:)] with [doc://com.apple.videosubscriberaccount/documentation/VideoSubscriberAccount/VSAccountMetadataRequest/isInterruptionAllowed] set to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], the system sends an authentication view controller to the delegate in the [doc://com.apple.videosubscriberaccount/documentation/VideoSubscriberAccount/VSAccountManagerDelegate/accountManager(_:present:)] method for your app to present to them.

## Displaying Authentication Views

- **accountManager(_:present:)**: Tells the delegate to present an authentication view controller.

## Dismissing Authentication Views

- **accountManager(_:dismiss:)**: Tells the delegate to dismiss an authentication view controller.

## Supporting Degradation Scenarios

- **accountManager(_:shouldAuthenticateAccountProviderWithIdentifier:)**: Asks the delegate whether to authenticate the user with the selected provider.

## Responding to account manager requests

- **delegate**: The delegate of the account manager object.

## Inherits From

- NSObjectProtocol

items.description: Tells the delegate to dismiss an authentication view controller.
items.name: accountManager(_:dismiss:)
